utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Clarify something for me. Isn’t the point of a communal meal the exchange of ideas and opinions? An opportunity to consider important issues of the day?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It is. You just kind of put a damper on things when you said, the next person I see talking with food in their mouth will be put to death.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, we could argue about who said what all night long, but to set things back on course, I will propose a new topic of conversation.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What is the best number? By the way, there’s only one correct answer.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Five million, three hundred eighteen thousand and eight?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wrong. The best number is 73. You’re probably wondering why.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Uh-uh.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We’re good.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: 73 is the 21st prime number. Its mirror, 37, is the 12th, and its mirror, 21, is the product of multiplying, hang on to your hats, seven and three. Eh? Eh? Did I lie?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We get it. 73 is the Chuck Norris of numbers.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Chuck Norris wishes. In binary, 73 is a palindrome, one-zero-zero-one-zero-zero-one which backwards is one-zero-zero-one-zero-zero-one, exactly the same. All Chuck Norris backwards gets you is Sirron Kcuhc.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Just for the record, when you enter five million three hundred eighteen thousand and eight in a calculator, upside-down it spells boobies.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Remember when you were wondering why the girls didn’t want to eat with us tonight?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, I get it now.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I love your little heart locket, Bernadette.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, thanks. Howard gave it to me. It’s the cutest thing. Every time I have dinner with his mom, the next day I get jewellery.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Did you know that the iconic Valentine’s heart shape is not actually based on the shape of a human heart, but rather on the shape of the buttocks of a female bending over?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, so I spent seventh grade dotting my I’s with little asses? Cool.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Hey, Penny, how’s it going?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, Zack, what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: My dad’s company prints the menus for this place. I’m just dropping off some new ones laminated. Makes ’em easier to clean if people throw up on ’em. Guess how I got the idea?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I got it, I got it. Uh, Zack, these are my friends Bernadette and Amy.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hoo.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Okay, well, it was good to see you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, you, too.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: He’s really cute. How do you know him?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, we went out a couple of times.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m often flummoxed by current slang. Does went out mean had intercourse?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, no. But in this case, yes.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Interesting. And was it not satisfactory?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, it was great. He just didn’t really challenge me on an intellectual level.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Couldn’t you just fool around with him and then listen to NPR?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wouldn’t help. Zack can’t even spell NPR.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s what I do with Howard. I’m much smarter than he is. But it’s important to protect his manhood.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hoo.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What’s the matter?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m suddenly feeling flushed. My heart rate is elevated, my palms are clammy, my mouth is dry. In addition, I keep involuntarily saying hoo.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, we know what’s causing that, don’t we?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s no mystery. I obviously have the flu coupled with sudden-onset Tourette’s syndrome.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Did you hear about the accident at the bio lab?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. What happened?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: They were injecting rats with radioactive isotopes and one of the techs got bit.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Did he get superpowers?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, he got five stitches and a tetanus shot.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh. Well, that’s disappointing.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, you get bit by a radioactive animal in a lab, you kind of want to turn into a superhero.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, but who’d want to become Rat-Man?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Who wouldn’t? You could zip through a maze in nothing flat, squeeze through really small holes, and shut down restaurants in a single bound. And the best part is, if I were Rat-Man, you could be my sidekick, Mouse Boy.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Mouse Boy?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You don’t like Mouse Boy? How about, uh, uh, Kid Vermin?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: First of all, if we had superpowers, I wouldn’t be the sidekick. You’d be the sidekick.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Rat-Man is nobody’s sidekick.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Leonard, settle this. Of the two of us, who’s the obvious sidekick?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, Leonard, who?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: 12 years after high school, and I’m still at the nerd table.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Aren’t you slicing that man’s brain a little too thin?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s too thin if I were making a foot-long brain sandwich at Quiznos. For examination under a two-photon microscope, it’s fine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, you’re the expert. If the correct way to do it is the wrong way, then I yield.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Very well. If you die and donate your body to science, I promise to slice your brain like Canadian bacon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Now, if you’ll excuse me, I have to take my temperature.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you monitoring your circadian rhythms in order to identify your periods of maximum mental acuity? I did that one summer. Ah, youth.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, I experienced some distressing symptoms last night, so I’m checking my vital signs every hour.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’d be happy to create a chart and participate in a differential diagnosis.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, that sounds like fun.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. What were the symptoms?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Elevated heart rate, moist palms, dry mouth and localized vascular throbbing.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Localized to what region?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Ears and genitalia.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Interesting. Not body parts that usually team up. What about environmental factors? Describe the scene for me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I was sitting in a restaurant with Penny and Bernadette, drinking water, carbonated as it was a special occasion. Penny’s friend Zack stopped by and said hello and I said hoo.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Zack.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Then why did you ask?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Ask what?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Who.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Zack.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, let’s start over. What did you say when Zack walked in?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hoo.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Zack.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Why do you keep saying Zack?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Because you keep saying who.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m not saying hoo now. I said hoo last night.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And the answer was Zack, correct?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: There was no question. I simply said hoo.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, I think I have enough to go on. Possible explanations for your symptoms are, in descending order of likelihood, hyperthyroidism, premature menopause, hosting an alien parasite or, and I only include it for the sake of covering absolutely all bases, sexual arousal.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Where would I have picked up an alien parasite?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: There you are.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, hey.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Let me ask you a question. What are you most afraid of?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t know. Um, nuclear war. Accidentally being buried alive. Any of those movies where you get that phone call that says you’re going to die, and then you do.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No. Something very specific that we both know you, Rajesh Koothrappali, are terrified of.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, type two diabetes runs in my family. The thought of losing a toe…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Spiders! You’re afraid of spiders!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What the heck is this?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: A jar with a big spider in it, of course. Bravery test. First one to take his hand out is the sidekick.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Are you crazy?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Perhaps. Are you scared?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No. But it’s a stupid test.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, really? What if the earth was in danger and the only way to save it was to stick your hand in a jar with a spider?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, yeah? What if the earth was in danger and the only way to save it was to take a shower in the locker room and let other guys see you naked?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, come on. That’s never gonna happen. Now put your hand in the jar or forever be revealed as my sidekick.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: All right, I will.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How did you get so brave all of a sudden?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s easy. The spider’s crawling up your arm.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Get it off! Get it off! Please, Raj! Ah! Ah! Ah! Please. Oh!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: My blood work shows thyroid function normal. Cortisol levels normal.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How about your follicle-stimulating hormone levels?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, I am not going through menopause.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you sure? You said that with the testy bark of an old biddy.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I think we need to face the cold, hard truth, I was sexually aroused by Penny’s friend Zack.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hang on. I don’t know that we’ve given the alien parasite hypothesis a fair shake.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Let’s look at this logically. I have a stomach, I get hungry. I have genitals, I have the potential for sexual arousal.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A cross we all must bear. You know, in difficult moments like this, I often turn to a force greater than myself.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Religion?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Star Trek. Did you see Star Trek: The Motion Picture?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t. It’s terrible. However, in it, we learn that when Spock finds himself drawn off the path of logic by feelings bubbling up from his human half, he suppresses them using the Vulcan mental discipline of Kolinar.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Are you suggesting we live our lives guided by the philosophies found in cheap science fiction?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Cheap science fiction?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Using Kolinar to suppress my anger at that last comment.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Is it possible that your concern for me at this moment is motivated by nothing more than simple jealousy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I hadn’t considered that. Give me a moment. All right, I’ve considered it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I reject it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You reject it because you don’t feel jealousy, or because you are suppressing jealousy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I think I’ll eat my lunch at home.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s not your lunch, Sheldon, those are the cadaver brain specimens.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. As they were incorrectly sliced, you can see how I could mistake them for my sashimi.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey. Isn’t tomorrow your usual laundry night?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The supermarket was out of my regular fabric softener. If this one under or over-softens, I’ll need time to make things right.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s thinking ahead.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: The alternative would be to think backwards. And that’s just remembering.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So how’s Amy?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy’s changed. I might have to let her go.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, no. Why?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I thought she was a highly evolved creature of pure intellect, like me. But recent events indicate that she may be a slave to her baser urges. Like you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Just going to skip over that insult.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What insult?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. That’s why I’m going to skip over it. Are you saying that Amy is, oh, what’s the

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Forget science. She’s horny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh! Okay. Wow.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s simple biology. There’s nothing I can do about it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What are you suggesting?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m suggesting there might be something you could do about Amy’s urges?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s illegal to spay a human being.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. That’s not what I had in mind.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. Oh! You mean something I could do.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I was hoping to avoid this. But I might as well get it over with. Thank you, Penny. I’ll let you know what happens.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, Amy, you lucky girl.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. This is Dr. Sheldon Cooper. Is this the Zack Johnson who used to have coitus with my neighbour Penny? Sorry to bother you. Hello. I’m looking for a Zack Johnson who used to have coitus with my neighbour Penny. Coitus. It means intercourse. And I have a feeling I’m speaking to the right Zack. This is Sheldon Cooper. Fine. Shelly. Yes, that does sound like a girl’s name. No, it doesn’t bother me. Yes, Smelly Shelly does bother me. Let me tell you why I’m calling. I’d like to know if you’d be interested in having sex with Amy Farrah Fowler. Amy Farrah Fowler. Yes, that is a girl’s name. Good grief. It’s like trying to talk to a dolphin.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? This is going to decide who’s the hero and who’s the sidekick?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You got a better idea?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Every idea is better than this idea.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ding!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wait. What the hell is ding?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s a bell.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t think this kind of wrestling has a bell.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Fine. How do you want to start?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I say, uh, how about one, two, three, go?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: One-two-three-go? That’s for babies.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, how about, uh, on your mark, get set, go?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s for a footrace. If you want to race, we have to go outside.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, it’s chilly outside. Didn’t bring my jacket.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, for crying out loud. What kind of superhero needs a jacket?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What kind of superhero says dibs on the red tights, dibs on the red tights.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, how about this? Ready, wrestle.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wait. Are we starting now? Or is that what you’re going to say when we do start, or…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We’re starting now!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Don’t yell at me!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Suppose there are worse ways to spend a Friday night. None come to mind.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Look at this stamp. On what authority are they permitted to mutilate patrons as they enter?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m sure it’ll wash off.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Little comfort tonight. I look like a Hell’s Angel.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: There’s Zack.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you sure this is what you want to do?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s not what I want to do, it’s what I have to do.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Go, Amy Farrah Fowler. Follow your endocrine system.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Thank you, Sheldon. You’re a good friend.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Please don’t drag this out. This is never going to come off.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Excuse me? Zack? I am Amy Farrah Fowler. We met the other night. I have spent my life in pursuit of pure knowledge. Until I met you, my decisions were founded in logic and reason. And yet here I stand before you, 130 pounds of raging estrogen, longing to grab hold of your gluteus maximus and make Shakespeare’s metaphorical beast with two backs.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: My gluteus what?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: On the other hand, as I look at the blank, ape-like expression on your face, I have decided to adopt the Vulcan practice of Kolinar. Good-bye, Zack.

utterance.speaker: Zack
utterance.content: Bye. Hoo. That should hold me for a while.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m legally obligated to inform you that I took a karate lesson when I was 11. I’d be a regular ninja by now if my mom could’ve arranged a carpool.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, yeah? Well, I’ve been taking Pilates class at the rec center, and my abs look like sections of a Hershey bar.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah? Won’t matter, you’re going down!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, uh-uh, you’re going down!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: If anybody’s going to go down, it’s going to be you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fellas. It’s been 30 minutes. Nobody’s touched each other.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m glad you decided to reject your animal hindbrain and return to the realm of pure intellect.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: As am I.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: An experiment. Nope. Nothing. Never mind.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You realize you can’t win.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I prefer to think that I can’t lose.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re wrong. It’s only a matter of time before you fall into Rat-Man’s rat trap.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You pathetic fool! If there were a rat-catcher, wouldn’t it catch Rat-Man?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Just because I didn’t express myself well doesn’t mean my underlying point was invalid! You bloviating buffoon!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You narcissistic nincompoop!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You crimson coward! Oh, Leonard, wake up, you’re missing some very excellent superhero quips.
